    Pilot Things API v1.0

    Scroll down for code samples, example requests and responses. Select a language for code samples from the tabs above or the mobile navigation menu.

    The purpose of this document is to specify the API and communication protocols served by Pilot Things.

    Base URLs:

    • https://pilot-things.com/api

    Terms of service Email: Support

    Authentication

    • HTTP Authentication, scheme: basic

    Thing management

    Get a list of things

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://pilot-things.com/api/things \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://pilot-things.com/api/things HTTP/1.1
Host: pilot-things.com
Accept: application/json

    GET /things

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {
  "data": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "sourceId": "string",
      "name": "string",
      "fixedName": "string",
      "description": "string",
      "tags": [
        {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string"
        }
      ],
      "status": "ACTIVE",
      "lastActivityDate": 0,
      "lastMessageDate": 0,
      "site": {
        "id": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "street": "string",
        "city": "string",
        "postalCode": "string",
        "countryCode": "string",
        "latitude": 0,
        "longitude": 0
      },
      "latitude": 0,
      "longitude": 0,
      "fixedLatitude": 0,
      "fixedLongitude": 0,
      "product": {
        "id": "string",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "manufacturer": {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "description": "string",
          "products": [
            null
          ]
        },
        "reference": "string",
        "category": "string",
        "connectivity": "string",
        "certification": "string",
        "infoUrl": "string",
        "model": {
          "id": "string",
          "name": "string",
          "description": "string",
          "attributes": [
            {
              "id": "string",
              "name": "string",
              "quantityKind": "string",
              "unit": "string",
              "model": null
            }
          ],
          "operations": [
            {
              "id": "string",
              "name": "string",
              "description": "string",
              "parameters": [
                "string"
              ]
            }
          ],
          "icon": "string",
          "color": "string"
        }
      }
    }
  ]
}

    <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<data>
  <id>string</id>
  <sourceId>string</sourceId>
  <name>string</name>
  <fixedName>string</fixedName>
  <description>string</description>
  <tags>
    <id>string</id>
    <name>string</name>
  </tags>
  <status>ACTIVE</status>
  <lastActivityDate>0</lastActivityDate>
  <lastMessageDate>0</lastMessageDate>
  <site>
    <id>string</id>
    <name>string</name>
    <description>string</description>
    <street>string</street>
    <city>string</city>
    <postalCode>string</postalCode>
    <countryCode>string</countryCode>
    <latitude>0</latitude>
    <longitude>0</longitude>
  </site>
  <latitude>0</latitude>
  <longitude>0</longitude>
  <fixedLatitude>0</fixedLatitude>
  <fixedLongitude>0</fixedLongitude>
  <product>
    <id>string</id>
    <name>string</name>
    <description>string</description>
    <manufacturer>
      <id>string</id>
      <name>string</name>
      <description>string</description>
      <products/>
    </manufacturer>
    <reference>string</reference>
    <category>string</category>
    <connectivity>string</connectivity>
    <certification>string</certification>
    <infoUrl>string</infoUrl>
    <model>
      <id>string</id>
      <name>string</name>
      <description>string</description>
      <attributes>
        <id>string</id>
        <name>string</name>
        <quantityKind>string</quantityKind>
        <unit>string</unit>
        <model/>
      </attributes>
      <operations>
        <id>string</id>
        <name>string</name>
        <description>string</description>
        <parameters>string</parameters>
      </operations>
      <icon>string</icon>
      <color>string</color>
    </model>
  </product>
</data>

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK Inline
    400 Bad Request Bad Request None
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized None
    403 Forbidden Forbidden None

    Response Schema

    Status Code 200

    Page

    Name Type Required Restrictions Description
    » data [Thing] true none none
    »» id string(uuid) true read-only none
    »» sourceId string false read-only Identifier provided by the source application
    »» name string true read-only Name provided by the source application
    »» fixedName string false none Name fixed by user
    »» description string false none none
    »» tags [Tag] false none none
    »»» id string(uuid) false none none
    »»» name string true none none
    »» status string false read-only none
    »» lastActivityDate number(date-time) false read-only none
    »» lastMessageDate number(date-time) false read-only none
    »» site Site false none none
    »»» id string(uuid) true none none
    »»» name string true none none
    »»» description string false none none
    »»» street string false none none
    »»» city string false none none
    »»» postalCode string false none none
    »»» countryCode string false none none
    »»» latitude number(double) false none none
    »»» longitude number(double) false none none
    »» latitude number(double) false read-only Latitude provided by the source application
    »» longitude number(double) false read-only Longitude provided by the source application
    »» fixedLatitude number(double) false none Latitude fixed by user
    »» fixedLongitude number(double) false none Longitude fixed by user
    »» product Product false none none
    »»» id string(uuid) true read-only none
    »»» name string true none none
    »»» description string false none none
    »»» manufacturer Manufacturer true none none
    »»»» id string(uuid) true read-only none
    »»»» name string true none none
    »»»» description string false none none
    »»»» products [Product] false none none
    »»» reference string false none none
    »»» category string false none none
    »»» connectivity string false none none
    »»» certification string false none none
    »»» infoUrl string false none none
    »»» model Model false none none
    »»»» id string(uuid) false read-only none
    »»»» name string false none none
    »»»» description string false none none
    »»»» attributes [Attribute] false none none
    »»»»» id string(uuid) false read-only none
    »»»»» name string false none none
    »»»»» quantityKind string false none none
    »»»»» unit string false none none
    »»»»» model Model false none none
    »»»» operations [Operation] false none none
    »»»»» id string(uuid) false read-only none
    »»»»» name string false none none
    »»»»» description string false none none
    »»»»» parameters [string] false none none
    »»»» icon string false none none
    »»»» color string false none none

    Enumerated Values

    Property Value
    status ACTIVE
    status INACTIVE
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: None

    Create a new thing

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X POST https://pilot-things.com/api/things \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    POST https://pilot-things.com/api/things HTTP/1.1
Host: pilot-things.com
Content-Type: application/json
Accept: application/json

    POST /things

    Body parameter

    {
  "fixedName": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "tags": [
    {
      "id": "string",
      "name": "string"
    }
  ],
  "site": {
    "id": "string",
    "name": "string",
    "description": "string",
    "street": "string",
    "city": "string",
    "postalCode": "string",
    "countryCode": "string",
    "latitude": 0,
    "longitude": 0
  },
  "fixedLatitude": 0,
  "fixedLongitude": 0,
  "product": {
    "name": "string",
    "description": "string",
    "manufacturer": {
      "name": "string",
      "description": "string",
      "products": [
        null
      ]
    },
    "reference": "string",
    "category": "string",
    "connectivity": "string",
    "certification": "string",
    "infoUrl": "string",
    "model": {
      "name": "string",
      "description": "string",
      "attributes": [
        {
          "name": "string",
          "quantityKind": "string",
          "unit": "string",
          "model": null
        }
      ],
      "operations": [
        {
          "name": "string",
          "description": "string",
          "parameters": [
            "string"
          ]
        }
      ],
      "icon": "string",
      "color": "string"
    }
  }
}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    body body Thing true none

    Example responses

    201 Response

  "sourceId": "string",
  "name": "string",

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    201 Created Created Thing
    400 Bad Request Bad Request None
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized None
    403 Forbidden Forbidden None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: None

    Get a thing details

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://pilot-things.com/api/things/{id} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    GET https://pilot-things.com/api/things/{id} HTTP/1.1
Host: pilot-things.com
Accept: application/json

    GET /things/{id}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    id path string(uuid) true none

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {
  "id": "string",
  "sourceId": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "fixedName": "string",

      "name": "string"

    Update a thing

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X PUT https://pilot-things.com/api/things/{id} \
  -H 'Accept: application/json'


    PUT https://pilot-things.com/api/things/{id} HTTP/1.1
Host: pilot-things.com
Accept: application/json

    PUT /things/{id}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    id path string(uuid) true none

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {
  "id": "string",
  "sourceId": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "fixedName": "string",

    Delete a thing

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X DELETE https://pilot-things.com/api/things/{id}


    DELETE https://pilot-things.com/api/things/{id} HTTP/1.1
Host: pilot-things.com

    DELETE /things/{id}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    id path string(uuid) true none

    Responses

    Status Meaning Description Schema
    200 OK OK None
    400 Bad Request Bad Request None
    401 Unauthorized Unauthorized None
    403 Forbidden Forbidden None
    404 Not Found Not found None
    To perform this operation, you must be authenticated by means of one of the following methods: None

    Get the picture of the thing

    Code samples

    # You can also use wget
curl -X GET https://pilot-things.com/api/things/{id}/image \
  -H 'Accept: image/jpeg'

    Execute an operation on a thing

  -H 'Accept: application/json'

Accept: application/json

    GET /network_applications/{id}

    Parameters

    Name In Type Required Description
    id path string(uuid) true Application ID

    Example responses

    200 Response

    {
  "id": "string",
  "name": "string",
  "description": "string",
  "status": "string",
  "statusCheckedDate": 0,
  "nodeId": "string"
}
